title: WASM API code generator type specs
description: Polyglot type definition for hybrid WASM/TypeScript applications

tag.description: Optional integer type to use. Defaults to `i32` Note: If C ABI compatibility is required, then `i32` MUST be used.

value.description: Integer value associated with this name

items.description: Names should be given in lowercase. Some code generators can be configured to auto-capitalize these names.

values.title: Possible enum names
values.description: Nonconsecutive or specific values are described via objects of `name`/`value` pairs.

type.description: This spec describes a function pointer type.
This spec describes a struct-style type.
This spec describes a union type.

stringOrArray.description: Each line will be automatically word-wrapped and prefixed with the appropriate comment syntax of the target language.

name.title: Type or field name
name.description: This name will be used as-is by all code generators and therefore should ensure to not violate naming rules of any of the intended target languages.

doc.title: Docstring for this type or field.

docArgs.description: With a few exceptions & language specific limitations, the range of possibilities is similar to field types.

field.description: Type spec for a single field within a struct or union. If `pad` is given, all other keys are ignored and the field is only considered for padding/alignment/sizing purposes. Names for padding fields will be autogenerated.

const.description: Marks type as constant / readonly data. Note: For pointers this refers to the target data, not to the pointer itself.

optional.description: Marks type as optional. Language specific and currently only supported for pointer types.

pad.description: Number of padding bytes. If given, all other keys are ignored.

default.description: Optional default value (or verbatim source code). If given as object, language specific defaults can be provided.

fieldType.title: Field type
fieldType.description:
Either a WASM primitive type, a preset name (i.e. `opaque` or `string`) or the name of another type in this document.

- `isize` / `usize` types will be sized depending on chosen WASM target (wasm32/wasm64).
- `opaque` types are always considered pointers only.
- `string` types are language specific and the result type can be configured via codegen options (i.e. slice vs. raw pointer).

fieldTag.title: Optional array type modifier
fieldTag.description: If `array` or `vec` is selected, the `len` MUST be given too. Note: Not all tags are natively supported by all languages and might result in generation of "polyfills". E.g. vectors are similar to arrays, but have stricter alignment & potentially different codegeneration (language specific).

fields.description: Array of fields specs for a struct or union type

typeTag.description:
Mainly Zig related. Optional layout qualifier to control alignment & sizing rules.

- The default alignment strategy (even if no tag is given) is the same as `extern`
- In Zig only `extern` and `packed` structs/unions, have a guaranteed memory layout, however only support a limited choice of field types.
- If `packed` is chosen (and considering the smallest supported field size of `u8`), all types & fields will have a theoretical alignment of 1 byte and NO automatic padding between/after fields. To ensure compatibility with the JS side of thi.ng/wasm-api, packed types will need to be manually allocated/aligned to at least 8 byte boundaries.

body.title: Optional custom per-language user code injections
body.description: Keys of this object are target language IDs and values are source code (will be automatically indented). Use object values (with `decl` and `impl` keys) for languages requiring multiple injection points for declaration vs. implementation (e.g. TypeScript).

oneOf.description: The `decl` and `impl` keys can be used for languages requiring multiple injection points for declarations (e.g. interface additions) vs. implementation methods (e.g. within a struct)

skip.description: List of language IDs for which code generation of this type should be skipped.
